Description: Fragment of a wooden beam, roughly rectangular in form, broken at either end. The surface is very split and worn.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east-north-east face of the casemate building B
Curator's comments: Like London, BM EA 23993, this fragment could be from one of the beams regularly laid between bricks to reinforce the structure of the walls, as usual for Late period mudbrick construction with concave courses. On "beam holes" visible in Chamber 22, see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 56 § 55, without following Petrie's hypothesis of a "roof". See also Boston, MFA, 87.14
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.55-56, p.176, pl.18)
